title.narrative: Sri Lanka - Second Health Sector Development Project

description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to upgrade the standards of performance of the public health system and enable it to better respond to the challenges of malnutrition and non-communicable diseases.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Finance and Mass Media
Ministry of Local Government and Provincial Councils

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee | Description: GOSL will constitute for monitoring and coordination of the project, aProject Steering Committee chaired by the Secretary of MOH,and including Senior Management of MOH, FC, and MLGPC, all nine HealthSecretaries, all nine PDHSs, and appropriate representativesfrom MOFP. | Due Date :31-Dec-2013

Finance Agreement: Environment Safeguards | Description: GOSL shall (a) by no later than February 28 each year, until thecompletion of the Project, commencing February 28, 2015, carry out an environmental assessment and prepare a report assessing theperformance of the Environment Management Framework (b) review by March 30 of such year, or such later date as requested, theenvironmental assessment report. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement: Financial Management and Reporting | Description: GOSL will ensure that financial records are maintained andprepare and furnish as part of the Project Report not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of each calendar quarter,interim unaudited financial reports for the Project covering such quarter period | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement: Reporting on Disbursement Linked Indicators | Description: GOSL will no later than March 31 each year,commencing March 31, 2014, prepare and furnish a report integrating the results of the DLIs and the monitoring and evaluationactivities performed on the progress achieved in the carrying out of the Project and in meeting meeting the targets for DLIs duringthe preceding calendar year. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: % of centrally managed health facilities with ETUs for that level of facility based on standard guidelines (DLI 1)
% of training institutes managed by the Ministry of Health meeting national standards
% of National Competitive Bidding (NCB) contracts awarded within the first nine months of the previous calendar year from 2014 onwards
% of provincially managed health facilities with ETUs for that level of facility based on standard guidelines (DLI 2)
% of provincially managed health facilities sending indoor morbidity data through e-IMMR (DLI 4)
No. of provinces with at least one health facility providing rehabilitation services
% of Medical Officer of Health areas with at least two healthy lifestyle centers (DLI 6)
% of laboratories in health facilities (base hospitals A and above) participating in the external quality assurance program for selected tests conducted by the Medical Research Institute
% of Medical Officer of Health areas with at least three health and nutrition community support groups
% of MOH managed health facilities sending indoor morbidity data through e-IMMR (DLI 3)
% of primary health care institutions having one month's buffer stock for 16 selected NCD drugs
% of MCH clinics that have an agreed package of equipment and supplies for the provision of care for pregnant women and children under five years. (DLI 5)
% of persons (over 40 years) screened for selected NCDs (diabetes, hypertension, cancer breast and oral) at healthy lifestyle centers
% of pregnant women with anaemia after the second trimester
% of CEMOC facilities providing 24x7 CEMOC services.
% of hospitals (base hospitals and above) that have obtained EPL and HWL
% of fully functioning quality management Units (QMUs) in provincially managed base hospitals and above (DLI 8)
% of the six-monthly cash forecast (for non-salary recurring and capital expenditures) released (DLI 9)
% of fully functioning quality management Units (QMUs) in MOH managed base hospitals and above (DLI 7)
